verses.verse: A Psalm<WH4210> of David<WH1732>. LORD<WH3068>, I cry<WH7121> unto thee: make haste<WH2363> unto me; give ear<WH238> unto my voice<WH6963>, when I cry<WH7121> unto thee.
Let my prayer<WH8605> be set forth<WH3559> before<WH6440> thee as incense<WH7004>; and the lifting up<WH4864> of my hands<WH3709> as the evening<WH6153> sacrifice<WH4503>. set: Heb. directed
Set<WH7896> a watch<WH8108>, O LORD<WH3068>, before my mouth<WH6310>; keep<WH5341> the door<WH1817> of my lips<WH8193>.

Incline<WH5186> not my heart<WH3820> to any evil<WH7451> thing<WH1697>, to practise<WH5953> wicked<WH7562> works<WH5949> with men<WH376> that work<WH6466> iniquity<WH205>: and let me not eat<WH3898> of their dainties<WH4516>.

Let the righteous<WH6662> smite<WH1986> me; it shall be a kindness<WH2617>: and let him reprove<WH3198> me; it shall be an excellent<WH7218> oil<WH8081>, which shall not break<WH5106> my head<WH7218>: for yet my prayer<WH8605> also shall be in their calamities<WH7451>. me; it shall be a: or, let the rigteous smite mee kindly, and reprove me; let not their precious oil break my head, etc
When their judges<WH8199> are overthrown<WH8058> in stony<WH5553> places<WH3027>, they shall hear<WH8085> my words<WH561>; for they are sweet<WH5276>.
Our bones<WH6106> are scattered<WH6340> at the grave's<WH7585> mouth<WH6310>, as when one cutteth<WH6398> and cleaveth<WH1234> wood upon the earth<WH776>.
But mine eyes<WH5869> are unto thee, O GOD<WH3069> the Lord<WH136>: in thee is my trust<WH2620>; leave<WH6168> not my soul<WH5315> destitute<WH6168>. leave: Heb. make not my soul bare
Keep<WH8104> me from the snares<WH3027> <WH6341> which they have laid<WH3369> for me, and the gins<WH4170> of the workers<WH6466> of iniquity<WH205>.
Let the wicked<WH7563> fall<WH5307> into their own nets<WH4364>, whilst that I withal<WH3162> escape<WH5674>. escape: Heb. pass over
